content:

title: Premium on CPO prices over soybean oil is not sustainable, says Mielke
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 8): Crude palm oil (CPO) prices have been trading at a premium over soybean oil for eight months. content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 8): Crude palm oil (CPO) prices have been trading at a premium over soybean oil for eight months. The premium pricing, however, is not sustainable, according to David Mielke, senior analyst and director at ISTA Mielke GmbH (Oil World), because of expected higher CPO production coupled with tight supplies of sunflower and rapeseed oil.

He anticipates the premium on CPO prices will normalise in the near future, meaning CPO would be priced at a discount over soybean oil.

summary: BRUSSELS: Brussels is delaying a plan to ban a wide swath of diesel cars from the capital of the European Union (EU) amid a wider backlash against climate measures.
content:
BRUSSELS: Brussels is delaying a plan to ban a wide swath of diesel cars from the capital of the European Union (EU) amid a wider backlash against climate measures.

The city last Friday backed a law to push enforcement of rules restricting Euro 5 diesel vehicles from its Low Emission Zone (LEZ), which encompasses 161 sq kms, by two years.

title: Europe’s urban dilemma
summary: VIENNA: Every tourist in Vienna is at some point directed to Michaelerplatz, a circular cobblestone plaza in the heart of the Austrian capital.
content:
VIENNA: Every tourist in Vienna is at some point directed to Michaelerplatz, a circular cobblestone plaza in the heart of the Austrian capital.

Framed by a medieval church, baroque buildings and the modernist Looshaus, the site’s iconic architecture attracts hundreds of thousands of people a year.

Yet in the summer months, when the square’s pavement and lack of shade transforms it into a heat island, visiting isn’t always a pleasant experience.
